1.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
full (literally or figuratively) or filling (literally); also (concretely) fulness; adverbially, fully
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)

2.brief: to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion

3.brief: silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
a pot or furnace (as if excavated)
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

4.brief: properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin

5.brief: to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated

6.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, an overhanging, i.e. (by implication) an excess, superiority, remainder; also a small rope (as hanging free)
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)

8.brief: graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent

9.brief: properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
{affection (in a good or a bad sense)}
to fold, i.e. duplicate (literally or figuratively); by implication, to transmute (transitive or intransitive)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)
familiar; a friend, also gentle; hence, a bullock (as being tame; applied, although masculine, to a cow); and so, a chieftain (as notable, like neat cattle)

10.brief: to sink, i.e. descend; causatively, to press or lead down
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction

11.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) rebellion; concretely, bitter, or rebellious
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

12.brief: to come in contact with, whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to concur
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly

13.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to withdraw (both literally and figuratively, whether intransitive or transitive)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

14.brief: to cleave or burst through, i.e. (causatively) to emit, whether literal or figurative (gape)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to pound, i.e. smite; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to disperse; also, to thrust off, down, out or upon (inclusively, reject, let alone, permit, remit, etc.)

15.brief: to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to be (causatively, do or declare) wrong; by implication, to disturb, violate
properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

16.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

17.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage

18.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange)
something given as security, i.e. (literally) a token (of safety) or (metaphorically) a bondsman
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

19.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
to soar, i.e. be lofty; figuratively, to be haughty
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)

a bone (as the skeleton of the body); hence, self, i.e. (figuratively) very

to take (in the widest variety of applications)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
